intro: Ethulia bechioides, commonly known as the slender-leaved milkweed, is a herbaceous plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species known for their milky sap. The plant typically features slender, ribbed stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Its flowers are small, clustered in umbels, and often have a pale yellow or greenish hue. Ethulia bechioides is adapted to grow in dry, open habitats and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
